page.title: 04CROOKHAM : EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Crookham Village is within the commuter belt and this is a feature of employment. However, there is employment on a part-time basis in the village shop and newsagents. The garage employs three people full-time on car sales and body repairs and one person part-time for office work. The hop-drying houses have been converted into four units for light industry giving eight people employment. There is a small electrical contractor providing 2 full-time jobs. The farm, smallholding and nursery employ fifteen people on horticultural work. The Post Office has a full-time manager and has been established since 1836, although on its present site from 1905.
